lsr.concurrence.webserver
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  lsr.concurrence.webserver.Configuration

public final class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object

Loads and manages the configuration of this application. The configuration is read from a standard Java properties file. By default, this class will try to load the file server.properties in the current working directory.

This class provides several convenience methods to retrieve values from the configuration, with support for default values and for parsing the value into a given format (eg., to an int).

This class is a Singleton, that is, it does not allow the creation of other instances than the one referenced by the field Configuration.config. To read a property, use the following: 

  String value = Configuration.config.getProperty(key, defaultValue);

Author:
LSR

Method Detail

getProperty

public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String defaultValue)
Retrieves a configuration property in a String format.

Parameters:
key - The name of the configuration property
defaultValue - The value to return if key is not found on the configuration.
Returns:
the property assocuated with key (or defaultValue) as string

getIntProperty

public int getIntProperty(java.lang.String key,
                          int defaultValue)
Retrieves a configuration property as integer.

Parameters:
key - The name of the configuration property
defaultValue - The value to return if key is not found on the configuration or if the value cannot be converted to an int.
Returns:
the property associated with key (or defaultValue) as int

getFileProperty

public java.io.File getFileProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String defaultValue)
Retrieves a configuration property as a File object. Some effort is made to correctly interpret file:// URLs and the like.

Parameters:
key - The name of the configuration property
defaultValue - The value to return if key is not found.
Returns:
he property associated with key (or defaultValue) as File.
